title: Hello, I'm Sam!
summary: Introduce greeting phrases, self-introductions, and asking someone's name through a short classroom story.
story_outline: A new student named Sam arrives in class and meets the teacher and classmates.
Students practice greeting each other and asking for names.
The class finishes by playing a name circle game to remember everyone.

vocabulary.usage: Say hello when you meet someone.
Respond when you learn someone's name.

activities: Sing a greeting song with clapping rhythm.
Role-play meeting a new classmate using the key sentences.
Play a name chain game: each child repeats previous names and adds their own.
teaching_tips: Encourage shy learners by letting them introduce a puppet or favorite toy first before speaking about themselves.
parent_extension: Ask the child to introduce family members at home using 'This is ...' sentences.

title: Look at the classroom
summary: Teach classroom objects, using 'this is/that is' and simple imperatives for paying attention.
story_outline: The teacher gives a quick tour of the classroom before the first art project.
Students practice saying what objects are and where they are.
A short clean-up challenge helps review vocabulary.

vocabulary.usage: Point to a book when saying the word.
Tap the desk lightly to get attention.
Introduce an item close to you.
Introduce an item a little farther away.

grammar_points: Imperatives for classroom instructions (Look!, Listen!, Touch...).
activities: Scavenger hunt: children find items the teacher names.
Drawing station: label a quick sketch of the classroom.
Clean-up countdown: say the target words while putting things away.
teaching_tips: Use exaggerated gestures for 'this' and 'that' to reinforce distance differences.
parent_extension: Invite the child to describe their study corner at home using 'This is ...' sentences.
